alert.note: Alert for Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hancock and southwestern Penobscot Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kenduskeag, or 8 miles west of Bangor, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bangor, Old Town, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Corinth, Veazie, Dedham, Kenduskeag, Indian Island, East Corinth, Grand Falls, Glenburn, Orrington, Holden, Milford, Levant, Carmel and Eddington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 167 and 203. State Highway 11 near East Corinth. State Highway 9 between Hampden and Aurora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
